results.title: Ron Magliozzi and Jenny He interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'

video_links.name: Ron Magliozzi and Jenny He interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'

results.brief_description: Jenny He (Curatorial Assistant, Department of Film) and Ron Magliozzi (Assistant Curator, Department of Film) are co-organizers of the Tim Burton exhibition, from MoMa (The Museum of Modern Art) in New York. Here they are interviewed by Kate Warren, ACMI’s Assistant Curator, about their work on ‘Tim Burton: The Exhibition’. They take us through the process, from inception, through to collaborating with Tim Burton, of Burton’s work and the curatorial process. As well as viewing Tim Burton’s work from an artistic perspective, we also gain insight into the art of the curator and curatorial perspective.

results.title: Raphael: the apprentice years. [Vol. 1]
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner, RM Arts and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
Part one of a two volume series, ‘Raphael: the apprentice years’ provides great background to Raphael’s life, influences, education and professional friendships as a young man up to the age of 25. In this documentary writer and narrator David Thompson (former critic of The Times) reappraises the work of Raphael providing an in-depth look into the development of his career and his relationships with mentors and leading contemporaries like Pierro Della Francesca, Leonardo di Vinci and Michelangelo. His formative years as an artist are covered from his life as a young apprentice in Urbino influenced by the work of Pierro Della Francesca to Peruggia where he was fellow student with Leonardo da Vinci and Florence where he had formed many of his friendships with notable contemporaries as Michelangelo. Shot on location the documentary discusses liberally the influences upon his work with in-depth coverage of his drawings, paintings and sculptural reliefs. What is revealed is Raphael’s passion for nature, light and colour, classicism, the ‘School of Athens’, mathematics and perspective.

results.title: Ron's story
results.creator_credit: Davide Grassi, Boris Greguric, Aldo Ivancic and Ron Athey
results.brief_description: Ron’s Story is a video based on the work and obsessions of Los Angeles-based extreme performance artist Ron Athey. The video is comprised of footage filmed at various performances staged at the Kapelica Gallery and the Cultural Centre Cankarjev dom in Ljubljana between 1996 and 2001.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Davide Grassi, Boris Greguric, Aldo Ivancic and Ron Athey

results.title: Romero
results.creator_credit: John Duigan, Ellwood Kieser, Four Seasons Entertainment and Paulist Pictures
results.brief_description: In a country ruled by a violent and oppressive military government, in a time when brutality, torture and murder destroyed a nation, one man rose to become the voice of the voiceless, champion of the poor, defender of human rights. Archbishop Oscar Romero of El Salvador stands beside Martin Luther King and Gandhi as one of history’s most heroic martyrs, whose courage and compassion became legendary. Romero’s influence on the people became so great in fact, that the military junta feared his power. In 1980, Bishop Romero died for his beliefs… at the hands of an assassin. His murderers have never been brought to trial. Raul Julia delivers a powerfully disturbing portrait of a man whose vision was truly inspirational.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Duigan, Ellwood Kieser, Four Seasons Entertainment and Paulist Pictures

results.title: Romeo and Juliet: a film-ballet after the tragedy by Shakespeare
results.brief_description: Historic performance by the legendary Galina Ulanova as Juliet and Yuri Zhdanov as Romeo in a version of Prokofiev’s ballet specially choreographed and staged for filming by L. Arnshtam and Leonid Lavrovsky and featuring the Ballet and Orchestra of the Moscow Bolshoi Theatre conducted by Gennadi Rozhdestvensky. Filmed on location in the USSR with English narration.

results.title: Penguins off the page
results.creator_credit: Jon Rowdon and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “RMIT Collection”.
A plasticine animation in a live action classroom. Today’s biology lesson is about the different types of penguins. The peculiar magic of wildlife comes to the classroom as penguins colonise his desk to bring each of the species of penguins to life. As the lesson progresses the class watches each species appear and play amongst the mess on the teacher’s desk.
